message: Kyler since the inception of Columbus being lost and arriving in the Americas, the undisciplined and barbaric ppl were already here, wrecking far worse & criminal (unpunished) behavior, that are still occuring. My husband and I ate in shifts so one could stay outside with our boy when our son would get """"in a mood"""" in a public place. So I get the frustration with long term crying. I get the frustration of the diner owner. No one behaved well and doing the media thing is ridiculous. Go back to your corners, folks, and move on.

The pituitary actually isn't in the center of the brain... It's tight between the eyes, right behind the skull and dangles in front of the brain. I sorry have a pituitary adenoma. The surgery is possible if the conditions are right. Usually they opt to treat with medication first. If the tumor is pressing on the optic nerve or if it's wrapped around the carotid artery, they cannot perform the surgery without risk of blindness or a bleed out. Pituitary disease influences mood swing, weight management, patience, fatigue levels, and certainly depression. Prolactinoma tumors are one of the most common adenomas and are usually, but not always, treatable with medication.
